message: I guess all the companies on the panel are more or less trying to get people to use their real identities
I think Yobongo is doing some interesting things here to prevent creepiness like requiring every user to have a userpic and verify their email
in the past, chat rooms were considered something that anyone could join anonymously

I think for a group chat application that it is important to know who the other participants are in certain (most?) situations. I like to think of most group chat as being intimate. Non verified make it easy to become a troll.
I've  been playing with Yobongo over the weekend, since they turned on the location stuff, and it's a different experience - chatting without any control over what room you're in.
